image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: The 36-year-old man was charged with two counts of sexual assault after a picnic with the alleged victim at a secluded spot at the Cotter Reserve just outside Canberra in 2020.

title.children: Jury fails to reach verdict in trial of former PhD student who allegedly 'love-bombed' and raped woman

image.altText: an artists impression of a commemorative coin

props.synopsis: Classic children's book written by Mem Fox and illustrated by Judy Horacek gets commemorated on 20-cent coin.

title.children: Where is the green sheep? On a 20-cent coin

image.altText: A male choir rehearses. There are two lines of men, with one line standing on a stop behind the others.

props.synopsis: The Canberra Men's Choir is an "awesome fellowship" and no auditions are required.

title.children: Retirement can be a 'trap' for men. So these blokes joined a choir

image.altText: Protesters sit down and chant at the Australian National University pro-Palestine encampment.

props.synopsis: The ANU has announced it will no longer invest in certain weapons companies in the long term, following months of pressure from pro-Palestinian student groups.

title.children: ANU to stop long-term investments in 'controversial' weapons manufacturers following months-long Gaza protest on campus

image.altText: A small group of people walk along a city street as a photographer paps them.

props.synopsis: The parents of former defence minister Linda Reynolds tell a WA court their daughter was viewed as a "monster" and they were shunned by friends after Brittany Higgins's explosive interview on Channel 10's the Project.

title.children: 'Accused of being a monster': Linda Reynolds's parents hit out in Brittany Higgins court battle

props.synopsis: Canberra Health Services said it received a "lot of feedback" on the post and had removed it for fear of it being "misinterpreted". It will now meet with members of a Canberra endometriosis support group who expressed concern about the messaging.

title.children: Apology issued after endometriosis, arthritis described as 'not an emergency' in hospital's social video

image.altText: Saline drip

props.synopsis: Patients are having to stay in hospital for longer periods and some elective surgeries face delays because of a global shortage of intravenous fluids, which doctors say they have been left "in the dark" about.

title.children: Patients forced to stay in hospital care units for longer amid IV fluid shortage

image.altText: A man looks at the camera with a neutral expression. Behind him a canal and a restaurant are visible.

props.synopsis: A "hero" security guard who tackled a knife-wielding man and freed the young Australian girl he'd been stabbing in a London shop has been honoured for his bravery.

title.children: 'I kicked the knife away': Security guard who saved 11yo Aussie girl stabbed in London hailed a 'hero'

props.synopsis: A Pacific archipelago in Australia's backyard has become a new front in a bitter feud between France and Azerbaijan.

title.children: How a tourist mecca off Australia's coast got entangled in France's feud with an enemy

image.altText: A medieval man holds a phone with the Sportsbet logo displayed.

props.synopsis: Changes to gambling advertising won't happen until next month at the earliest as the government scrambles to manage a caucus pushback and resistance from the crossbenches.

title.children: Government pushes back gambling advertising reforms, tussling over internal resistance

image.altText: A teacher is seen at the front of a primary school classroom

props.synopsis: Upwey South Primary School's academic results have lifted dramatically over the past six years. The principal puts it down to a shift in teaching styles.

title.children: This public school's academic results have skyrocketed over the past six years. Here's how they did it

image.altText: A man with glasses speaking at a press conference

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton has never liked the idea of Australia accepting Palestinians fleeing the conflict in Gaza and has never been shy of saying so. Now, though, he's at odds with the spy chief.

title.children: There's no grey in Dutton's views on the war in Gaza. Not even Australia's spy chief can shift his position

image.altText: Two soldiers sit on top of a small tank, driving in front of a second small tank, on a deserted road.

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said more than 100 Russian soldiers had been captured as prisoners of war, to "speed up the return home of our boys and girls".

title.children: Ukrainian forces 'moving further' into Russia as more than 100 soldiers captured, Zelenskyy says

image.altText: A full moon is seen through clouds above Stonehenge

props.synopsis: The Altar Stone, long believed to have come from Wales, may have been transported via sea from Scotland, according to new research from an Australian team.

title.children: 'Completely unexpected': Stonehenge's central stone may have come from 700km away, new research suggests

image.altText: A close up of Yahya Sinwa at a rally among a crowd of people.

props.synopsis: Three senior Iranian officials have said that only a ceasefire deal in Gaza would hold Iran back from direct retaliation against Israel for the assassination of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh.

title.children: Hamas to stay out of Gaza truce talks but may meet mediators afterwards

image.altText: Brooke Oliver in a dark room

props.synopsis: Advocates say more need to be done to support at-risk youth to break the poverty and homelessness cycle.

title.children: Young people are struggling to find houses. It's even harder for at-risk youth

image.altText: An e-scooter stands on a footpath.

props.synopsis: Experts say the City of Melbourne's snap decision to end its share hire e-scooter scheme is sending shock waves around the country, as states decide whether the vehicles are worth the safety risk.

title.children: Melbourne's decision to ban share hire e-scooters could send 'shock waves' to other Australian cities

image.altText: Generic photos of apartments, balconies

props.synopsis: The Coalition is developing a policy to lower the barriers for would-be homebuyers to get a loan, as part of an election pitch to "aspirational" young Australians within sight of home ownership.

title.children: Coalition to push for first homebuyers to get easier access to home loans

image.altText: A woman stands behind a young man in a wheelchair and placards reading '12 years is too long'

props.synopsis: Asylum seekers are staging a 24/7 protest outside the Department of Home Affairs and the minister Tony Burke's office, demanding that they be granted permanent visas.

title.children: Refugees, asylum seekers camp outside Home Affairs for the right to 'call Australia home'

image.altText: Blake Wilson

props.synopsis: The helicopter pilot who was killed after crashing into the roof of a Cairns hotel moved to Queensland in April, declaring on social media he was "excited to see what this adventure brings".

title.children: What we know about Blake Wilson, the pilot of the helicopter that crashed into a Cairns hotel

image.altText: James Elliot-Watson and equality campaigners at a press conference inside parliament house

props.synopsis: Equality campaigner James Elliot-Watson — who says he was punished by his Christian school for being gay — has warned that the government's decision not to push forward with religious discrimination reform will cause further harm.

title.children: 'Gutless': Equality advocates slam government over broken religious discrimination promise

image.altText: Man and woman smile at camera with Greek houses made from white concrete behind them

props.synopsis: Andrew and Michele are dipping into their retirement funds to travel the world, and they don't feel guilty about it. Their daughters are financially independent, which they credit to early education on money matters.

title.children: How teaching their kids financial literacy helped set this couple up for retirement

image.altText: Star trails over land and water

props.synopsis: Sink into your chair and prepare your brain for a battle with knowledge. With questions ranging from the Moon to Sirius and celestial gems outside our galaxy, this quiz will stretch the boundaries of your mind.

title.children: Think you're pretty night-sky-smart? Take our star-crossed quiz to find out

image.altText: A close up view of a smoke stack at the Whyalla steelworks, taken at sunset

props.synopsis: Multiple sources have told ABC News several contractors who supply services to the Whyalla Steelworks are owed payment by the plant's owner, with some fearing there may be job losses if the situation does not improve.

title.children: Whyalla steelworks contractors owed tens of thousands of dollars by GFG Alliance

image.altText: Stokes Bay on the north coast of South Australia's Kangaroo Island.

props.synopsis: Emergency services have found two bodies in waters off Kangaroo Island after a boat was reported capsized on Wednesday afternoon.

title.children: Two men dead in waters off Kangaroo Island after boat capsizes

image.altText: A bearded man lifts a smiling woman in his arms on a brightly lit internal staircase.

props.synopsis: Not many speed daters expect to take a whiff of potential lovers as an introduction, but in the name of science that's what happened at a Sydney speed-dating event as part of National Science Week.

title.children: Love at first sniff? Step into the Love Lab for a chance at a match made in science heaven

image.altText: A man in a grey shirt sits in front of a microphone

props.synopsis: Thailand's Constitutional Court has removed Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin from office for violating the constitution over a cabinet appointment.

title.children: Thailand's constitutional court removes PM from office over ethical violations

image.altText: Four men in military uniform walk towards a grey plane marked "Luftwaffe".

props.synopsis: The base has been sealed off and soldiers advised not to drink tap water after a suspicious water-contamination incident, a security source said.

title.children: Authorities investigate suspected sabotage at German military base

image.altText: A statue of a soldier riding a horse on top of a monument with names listed

props.synopsis: A proposal to add Harry "Breaker" Morant's name to a large public memorial has been knocked back, after Adelaide councillors were warned that commemorating the convicted war criminal would risk "reputational damage" to the entire city.

title.children: Divisive digger executed for murdering civilians won't have name added to war memorial, council rules

image.altText: a young girl

props.synopsis: Yingying Xu, 46, has been charged with the murder of her daughter at their home on Tuesday.

title.children: Mother charged with murder of 10-year-old daughter on the Gold Coast

image.altText: A smiling woman of Iranian heritage wearing a loose head scarf and a blue jacket. A whiteboard is behind her

props.synopsis: Four students and a teacher meet in an Iranian classroom to learn English. The result is an acclaimed play by Sanaz Toossi that unpacks the migrant experience.

title.children: This Pulitzer Prize-winning comedy about life in Iran will make you laugh out loud

image.altText: a young woman holds up a green 'P' plate

props.synopsis: Assessors falling asleep mid-test, teens lying in their logbooks, and busloads of metro learners going regional. These are the ways Australian drivers are cheating the drivers licence system.

title.children: Australians 'gaming the system' to get drivers licences as road deaths rise again

image.altText: A group of women sit on picnic rugs under a tree in a park.

props.synopsis: Loneliness can increase the risk of developing health complications, so these women are finding new friendships among the strangers they share park picnics with.

title.children: Making friends as an adult can be hard, so these picnics are helping break the loneliness cycle

image.altText: the mayor of woollahra council in sydney richard shields stands outdoors on a beach cliff

props.synopsis: The NSW Liberal Party blames limited resourcing for missing a critical deadline to nominate candidates for local council elections in September.

title.children: 'Catastrophic failure': NSW Liberals miss deadline to nominate candidates for local elections

image.altText: arisa trew in her australian olympic uniform

props.synopsis: Arisa Trew touches down at Gold Coast Airport, the last leg of her journey from the Paris Olympics, looking forward to getting back to school — and the skate park.

title.children: Friends and classmates welcome Australia's youngest Olympian home
